(1) The drop in Total Air Time in 1954 is due largely to the fact that the
Network fee was doubled (from 1/4 ultimate full rate to 1/2 full rate)
on July 1, 1953 „ and many smaller stations had to drop the Network
service (although many later rejoined) as of that date. However, this
loss does not become so evident until 1354 because a larger number
of stations had taken programs during the first half of 1953. Then
another increase in July, 1954 caused another drop which reduced the
number of orders during the last half of the calendar year.
(2) For the first time in 1955 distribution of "Special" programs was in¬
cluded in the statistical record of program distribution. Due to incom¬
plete earlier records in this category the 1955 figures include "Special5’
programs for all previous years as well as 1955. This, at least in large
measure, accounts for the great increase over 1954 and the lower
figures in 1956 and 1957 which include the "Special" programs for
these years but not a previous accumulation. Taking this into account
shows a steadily encouraging rise from 1954 to the present.
